new_rev5_only.title: Access Enforcement | Restrict Access to Specific Information Types
new_rev5_only.change_details: Restrict direct access to data repositories containing specific data types

new_rev5_only.title: Access Enforcement | Assert and Enforce Application Access
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Require applications to assert, as part of the installation process, the access needed to the following system applications and functions
Provide an enforcement mechanism to prevent unauthorized access
Approval of access changes after initial installation of the application

new_rev5_only.title: Access Enforcement | Attribute-Based Access Control
new_rev5_only.change_details: Enforce attribute-based access control policy over defined subjects and objects and control access based upon attributes to assume access permissions

new_rev5_only.title: Access Enforcement | Individual Access
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Mechanisms for individuals to have access to PII
Incorporates individual access elements of withdrawn App J control IP-2

new_rev5_only.title: Access Enforcement | Discretionary and Mandatory Access Control
new_rev5_only.change_details: Enforce mandatory and discretionary policy over covered subjects and objects as specified in the policy

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Modify Non-Releasable Information
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implementing modification actions to non-releasable information when transferring information between different security domains to help prevent a data spill or attack

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Internal Normalized Format
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the parsing of incoming data into an internal normalized format and regenerating the data to be consistent with its intended specification to stop malicious attacks and large classes of data exfiltration

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Data Sanitization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Sanitizing data to minimize delivery of malicious content, command and control of malicious code, malicious code augmentation, and steganography encoded data; spillage of sensitive information in accordance with organization-defined policy

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Audit Filtering Actions
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the recording and auditing of content filtering actions and results for the information being filtered

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Redundant/Independent Filtering Mechanisms
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the implementation of content filtering solutions that provide redundant and independent filtering mechanisms for each data type

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Linear Filter Pipelines
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the implementation of a linear content filter pipeline that is enforced with discretionary and mandatory access controls

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Filter Orchestration Engines
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the employment of content filter orchestration engines to ensure content filtering mechanisms successfully complete execution without errors; and content filtering actions occur in the correct order and comply with organization-defined policy

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Filter Mechanisms Using Multiple Processes
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the implementation of content filtering mechanisms using multiple processes

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Failed Content Transfer Prevention
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the prevention of the transfer of failed content to the receiving domain

new_rev5_only.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Process Requirements for Information Transfer
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requiring the processes that transfer information between filter pipelines does not filter message content, validates filtering metadata, ensures the content associated with the filtering metadata has successfully completed filtering, and transfers the content to the destination filter pipeline

new_rev5_only.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Biometric Attempt Limiting
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Limits the number of unsuccessful biometric logon attempts
Explains the functional limitations of biometrics

new_rev5_only.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Use of Alternate Authentication Factor
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Allows the use of authentication factors  different from the primary authentication factors after the number of consecutive invalid logon attempts have been exceeded and enforces a limited number of consecutive invalid logon attempts through use of the alternative factors during a specified time period
Reinforces the availability benefit of allowing a user that has inadvertently been locked out to use additional authentication factors to bypass the lockout

new_rev5_only.title: Session Termination | Termination Message
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Reuses control text from AC-12(1)b associated with displaying a logout message and specifically names it 'termination message'
Reuses text about logout messaging previously in AC-12(1) in discussion

new_rev5_only.title: Session Termination | Timeout Warning Message
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires the display of an explicit message to users indicating their session will end in a specific amount of time
Discussion specifies session termination time period is based on the parameters defined in the AC-12 base control

new_rev5_only.title: Remote Access | Authenticate Remote Commands
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Control includes two parameters and discussion about need to authenticate commands issued remotely
Incorporates withdrawn control SI-3(9)

new_rev5_only.title: Use of External Systems | Portable Storage Devices – Prohibited Use
new_rev5_only.change_details: Control prohibits the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices on external systems

new_rev5_only.title: Literacy Training and Awareness | Social Engineering and Mining
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide literacy training on recognizing and reporting potential and actual instances of social engineering and social mining

new_rev5_only.title: Literacy Training and Awareness | Suspicious Communications and Anomalous System Behavior
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Providing awareness training on recognizing suspicious communications and anomalous behavior in organizational systems using specific indicators of malicious code
Incorporates withdrawn control AT-3(4)

new_rev5_only.title: Literacy Training and Awareness | Advanced Persistent Threat
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide literacy training on the advanced persistent threats to detect and to preclude success attacks

new_rev5_only.title: Literacy Training and Awareness | Cyber Threat Environment
new_rev5_only.change_details: Providing awareness training on the cyber threat environment; it should reflect on the current cyber threat information in system operations that support organizational missions and business functions

new_rev5_only.title: Role-Based Training | Processing Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Provide specific personnel or roles with initial and at a specific frequency training in the employment and operation of PII processing and transparency controls
Incorporates training elements of withdrawn App J control UL-2

new_rev5_only.title: Training Feedback
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide feedback on organizational training results to specified personnel

new_rev5_only.title: Content of Audit Records | Limit Personally Identifiable Information Elements
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Limit PII contained in audit records to the specific elements identified in the privacy risk assessment

new_rev5_only.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Alternate Audit Logging Capability
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Provide an alternate audit logging capability in the event of a failure in primary audit logging capability 
Includes withdrawn control AU-15

new_rev5_only.title: Protection of Audit Information | Store On Component With Different Operating System
new_rev5_only.change_details: Store audit information on a component running a different operating system than the system or component being audited

new_rev5_only.title: Audit Record Generation | Query Parameter Audits of Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide and implement  the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing PII

new_rev5_only.title: Monitoring for Information Disclosure | Unauthorized Replication of Information
new_rev5_only.change_details: Seeks to identify spoofed websites, etc.

new_rev5_only.title: Cross-Organizational Audit Logging | Disassociability
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Implements measures to disassociate individuals from audit information transmitted across organizational boundaries 
Discusses the use of privacy-enhancing cryptographic techniques to reduce privacy risk while maintaining accountability

new_rev5_only.title: Information Exchange | Transfer Authorizations
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to H Security Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Verify that individuals or systems transferring data between interconnecting systems have the requisite authorizations

new_rev5_only.title: Information Exchange | Transitive Information Exchanges
new_rev5_only.change_details: Identify transitive (downstream) information exchanges with other systems  and take measures to ensure that transitive information exchanges cease when the controls cannot be verified or validated

new_rev5_only.title: Authorization | Joint Authorization — Intra - Organization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ a joint authorization process  that includes multiple authorizing officials from the same organization

new_rev5_only.title: Authorization | Joint Authorization — Inter - Organizations
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ a joint authorization process that includes multiple authorizing officials with at least one authorizing official from an organization external to the organization conducting the authorization

new_rev5_only.title: Continuous Monitoring | Risk Monitoring
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy

new_rev5_only.title: Continuous Monitoring | Consistency Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ specific actions to validate that policies  are established and implemented controls operate in a consistent manner

new_rev5_only.title: Continuous Monitoring | Automation Support for Monitoring
new_rev5_only.change_details: Ensure the accuracy, currency, and availability of monitoring results for the system using specified automated mechanisms

new_rev5_only.title: Penetration Testing | Facility Penetration Testing
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ a penetration testing process that includes defined frequency of announced and unannounced attempts to bypass or circumvent physical access point controls

new_rev5_only.title: Configuration Change Control | Review System Changes
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Review changes to the system at a specific frequency or for specific circumstances to determine whether unauthorized changes have occurred
Incorporates withdrawn control CM-5(2)

new_rev5_only.title: Configuration Change Control | Prevent or Restrict Configuration Changes
new_rev5_only.change_details: Prevent or restrict changes to the configuration of the system under the specific circumstances

new_rev5_only.title: Least Functionality | Confined Environments With Limited Privileges
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires specified user-installed software execute in a confined physical or virtual machine environment with limited privileges
Incorporates withdrawn control SI-7(11)

new_rev5_only.title: Least Functionality | Code Execution In Protected Environments
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Allows execution of binary or machine-executable code only in confined physical or virtual machine environments and with approval
Incorporates withdrawn control SI-7(13)

new_rev5_only.title: Least Functionality | Binary or Machine Executable Code
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Prohibits the use of binary or machine-executable code; allows exceptions only for compelling mission or operational requirements
Incorporates withdrawn control SI-7(14)

new_rev5_only.title: Least Functionality | Prohibiting the Use of Unauthorized Hardware
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires specification of hardware components authorized for use and requires review and update of authorized components at specified frequency

new_rev5_only.title: User-Installed Software | Automated Enforcement and Monitoring
new_rev5_only.change_details: Enforce and monitor compliance with software installation policies

new_rev5_only.title: Information Location
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Identify and document the location of specific information and the specific system components on which the information resides; the users who have access; and changes to the location where the information resides

new_rev5_only.title: Information Location | Automated Tools to Support Information Location
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Use automated tools to identify specific information by information type on specific system components to ensure controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual privacy

new_rev5_only.title: Data Action Mapping
new_rev5_only.change_details: Develop and document a map of system data actions; noting the system operations that process personally identifiable information, encompassing the full information life cycle

new_rev5_only.title: Signed Components
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Prevent the installation of specified software and firmware components without verifying the component has been digitally signed using a recognized and approved certificate
Incorporates withdrawn control CM-5(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Contingency Plan Testing | Self-Challenge
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ specified mechanisms to specified systems or system components to disrupt and adversely affect the system or system component

new_rev5_only.title: System Backup | Cryptographic Protection
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires implementing cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of specified backup information

new_rev5_only.title: Identifier Management | Pairwise Pseudonymous Identifiers
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires generating pairwise pseudonymous identifiers, an opaque unguessable subscriber identifier generated by an identify provider for use at a specific individual relying party

new_rev5_only.title: Identifier Management | Attribute Maintenance and Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Maintain the attributes for each uniquely identified individual, device, or service in specified protected central storage

new_rev5_only.title: Authenticator Management | In-Person or Trusted External Party Authenticator Issuance
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires the issuance specified types of and/or specified authenticators be conducted either in person; by a trusted external party before a specified registration authority with authorization by specified personnel or roles

new_rev5_only.title: Authenticator Management | Presentation Attack Detection for Biometric Authenticators
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ presentation attack detection mechanisms for biometric-based authentication

new_rev5_only.title: Authenticator Management | Password Managers
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ specified password managers and password protection controls

new_rev5_only.title: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) | Disassociability
new_rev5_only.change_details: Use specified measures to disassociate user attributes or identifier assertion relationships among individuals, credential service providers, and relying parties

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Identity proof users for logical access based on identity assurance level requirements

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | Supervisor Authorization
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Require  the registration process to receive an account for logical access includes supervisor or sponsor authorization 
Incorporates withdrawn control IA-4(2)

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | Identity Evidence
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requiring evidence of individual identification be presented to the registration authority reduces the likelihood of individuals using fraudulent identification to establish an identity
Incorporates withdrawn control IA-4(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | Identity Evidence Validation and Verification
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Require the presented identity evidence be validated and verified through specified methods

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | In-Person Validation and Verification
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to H Security Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Require the validation and verification of identity evidence be conducted in person before a designated registration authority
Incorporates withdrawn controls IA-4(7) and IA-5(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | Address Confirmation
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Require a registration code or notice of proofing be delivered through an out-of-band channel to verify the users address (physical or digital) of record

new_rev5_only.title: Identity Proofing | Accept Externally-Proofed Identities
new_rev5_only.change_details: Accept externally-proofed identities at specified identity assurance level

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Response Training | Breach
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide incident response training on how to identify and respond to a breach

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Response Testing | Continuous Improvement
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires qualitative and quantitative data from testing to determine the effectiveness and continuously improve incident response processes by capturing incident response measures and metrics that are accurate, consistent, and in a reproducible format

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Handling | Integrated Incident Response Team
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to H Security Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Establish and maintain an integrated incident response team that can be deployed to any location identified by the organization
Includes withdrawn control IR-10

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Handling | Malicious Code and Forensic Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details: Analyze malicious code  and/or other residual artifacts remaining in the system after the incident.

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Handling | Behavior Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details: Analyze anomalous or suspected adversarial behavior

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Handling | Security Operations Center
new_rev5_only.change_details: Establish and maintain a security operations center

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Handling | Publication Relations and Reputation Repair
new_rev5_only.change_details: Manage public relations associated with an incident and employ measures to repair the reputation of the organization

new_rev5_only.title: Incident Response Plan | Breaches
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Adds additional processes in the Incident Response Plan for breaches involving personally identifiable information
Incorporates PII-related elements of withdrawn App J control SE-2

new_rev5_only.title: Maintenance Tools | Execution with Privilege
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires monitoring of the use of maintenance tools that execute with increased system privilege

new_rev5_only.title: Maintenance Tools | Software Updates and Patches
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires inspection of maintenance tools to ensure they are current

new_rev5_only.title: Field Maintenance
new_rev5_only.change_details: Restrict or prohibit field maintenance on specified systems or system components to trusted maintenance facilities

new_rev5_only.title: Physical Access Control | Physical Barriers
new_rev5_only.change_details: Limit access using physical barriers

new_rev5_only.title: Physical Access Control | Access Control Vestibules
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ access control vestibules at specific locations within the facility to prevent piggybacking or tailgating

new_rev5_only.title: Visitor Access Records | Limit Personally Identifiable Information Elements
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Limit PII contained in visitor access records specified elements identified in the privacy risk assessment

new_rev5_only.title: Electromagnetic Pulse Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ specified protective measures against electromagnetic pulse damage for specified systems and system components

new_rev5_only.title: Component Marking
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Mark specified system hardware components indicating the impact level or classification level of the information permitted to be processed, stored, or transmitted by the hardware component
Incorporates withdrawn control PE-5(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Facility Location
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires the planning of the location or site of the facility where the system resides considering physical and environmental hazards, and for existing facilities, considering the physical and environmental hazards in the organizational risk management strategy
Incorporates withdrawn control PE-18(1)

new_rev5_only.title: Baseline Selection
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Selecting a control baseline for the system to address the protection needs of a group, organization, or community of interest, represents a starting point
Discussion references CNSSI No. 1253

new_rev5_only.title: Baseline Tailoring
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Tailoring the selected control baseline by applying specified tailoring actions allows organizations to specialize or customize a set of baseline controls to reflect their specific missions and business functions, environments where their systems operate, the threats and vulnerabilities that can affect their systems, and any other conditions or situations that can impact their mission or business success
Discussion references NIST SP 800-53B

new_rev5_only.title: System Inventory | Inventory of Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires development and periodic update of an inventory of all programs and systems that process PII
Incorporates withdrawn App J control SE-1, and inventory of PII elements of withdrawn App J control DM-1

new_rev5_only.title: Enterprise Architecture | Offloading
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires offload of specified  non-essential supporting services to non-critical systems or system components

new_rev5_only.title: Threat Awareness Program | Automated Means for Sharing Threat Intelligence
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires employment of an automated means of sharing threat intelligence information

new_rev5_only.title: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information On External Systems
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires establishment of policy and procedures to ensure protection of controlled unclassified information on external systems

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Program Plan
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires development of an organization-wide privacy program plan
Incorporates privacy plan development elements of withdrawn App J control AR-1

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Program Leadership Role
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires appointment of a senior agency official to a privacy role
Incorporates appointment of a senior agency official for privacy elements of withdrawn App J control AR-1

new_rev5_only.title: Dissemination of Privacy Program Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires dissemination of privacy program information to the public
Incorporates withdrawn App J control TR-3, and publishing elements of withdrawn App J control IP-2

new_rev5_only.title: Dissemination of Privacy Program Information | Privacy Policies on Websites, Applications, and Digital Services
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires development and posting of privacy policies on all external-facing websites, mobile applications, and other digital services

new_rev5_only.title: Accounting of Disclosures
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires accounting of disclosures of PII
Incorporates withdrawn App J control AR-8

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Management
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires development of policies and procedures for ensuring quality management of PII
Incorporates dissemination of notice and appeals elements of withdrawn App J control IP-3
Addresses withdrawn App J control DI-1

new_rev5_only.title: Data Governance Body
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires establishment of a data governance body

new_rev5_only.title: Data Integrity Board
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires establishment of a data integrity board
Incorporates withdrawn App J control DI-2

new_rev5_only.title: Minimization of Personally Identifiable Information Used In Testing, Training, and Research
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires implementation of policies and procedures to minimize PII used in testing, training and research
Incorporates withdrawn App J control DM-3

new_rev5_only.title: Complaint Management
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires implementation of a complaint management process for organizational security and privacy practices
Incorporates withdrawn App J control IP-4

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Reporting
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires development and dissemination of privacy reporting
Incorporates withdrawn App J control AR-6

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Framing
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires identification and documenting of risk framing activities

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Management Program Leadership Roles
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires appointment of a senior accountable official for risk management and establishment of a risk executive function

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Strategy
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires development and implementation of a supply chain risk management strategy

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Strategy | Suppliers of Critical or Mission-Essential Items
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires identification, prioritization, and assessment of suppliers of critical or mission-essential technologies, products, and services

new_rev5_only.title: Continuous Monitoring Strategy
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires development and implementation of a continuous monitoring strategy

new_rev5_only.title: Purposing
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires analysis of mission essential services and functions to ensure they are being used consistent with their intended purpose

new_rev5_only.title: Personnel Screening | Citizenship Requirements
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires specifying citizenship verification

new_rev5_only.title: Position Descriptions
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires incorporation of security and privacy roles and responsibilities into organizational position descriptions

new_rev5_only.title: (PII Processing and Transparency) Policy and Procedures
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Personally identifiable information processing and transparency policy and procedures and the associated processing permissions controls

new_rev5_only.title: Authority to Process Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Determine and document the authority that permits the processing of personally identifiable information; and restrict the processing of this information to only the authorized purposes.
Incorporates withdrawn App J control AP-1, and PII processing authority elements of withdrawn App J control UL-2

new_rev5_only.title: Authority to Process Personally Identifiable Information | Data Tagging
new_rev5_only.change_details: Attach data tags containing defined permissible processing to defined elements of personally identifiable information

new_rev5_only.title: Authority to Process Personally Identifiable Information | Automation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Manage enforcement of the authorized processing of personally identifiable information using defined automated mechanisms

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing Purposes
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Identifying and documenting the purpose for processing provides organizations with a basis for understanding why personally identifiable information may be processed
Incorporates withdrawn App J controls AP-2 and UL-1, and PII processing purposes elements of withdrawn App J control UL-2

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing Purposes | Data Tagging
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires data tags to support tracking of processing purposes by conveying the purposes along with the relevant elements of personally identifiable information throughout the system

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing Purposes | Automation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Automated mechanisms augment tracking of the processing purposes

new_rev5_only.title: Consent
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Consent allows individuals to participate in making decisions about the processing of their information and transfers some of the risk that arises from the processing of personally identifiable information from the organization to an individual
Incorporates withdrawn App J control IP-1

new_rev5_only.title: Consent | Tailored Consent
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide defined mechanisms to allow individuals to tailor processing permissions to selected elements of personally identifiable information

new_rev5_only.title: Consent | Just-In-Time Consent
new_rev5_only.change_details: Just-in-time consent enables individuals to participate in how their personally identifiable information is being processed at the time or in conjunction with specific types of data processing when such participation may be most useful to the individual

new_rev5_only.title: Consent | Revocation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Revocation of consent enables individuals to exercise control over their initial consent decision when circumstances change

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Notice
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Privacy notices help inform individuals about how their personally identifiable information is being processed by the system or organization
Incorporates withdrawn App J control TR-1, and individual access request notice elements of withdrawn App J control IP-2

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Notice | Just-In-Time Notice
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Just-in-time notices inform individuals of how organizations process their personally identifiable information at a time when such notices may be most useful to the individuals
Incorporates update elements of withdrawn App J control TR-1

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Notice | Privacy Act Statements
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Include Privacy Act statements on forms that collect information that will be maintained in a Privacy Act system of records, or provide Privacy Act statements on separate forms that can be retained by individuals
Incorporates Privacy Act statements elements of withdrawn App J control TR-2

new_rev5_only.title: System of Records Notice
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Federal agencies must publish a system of records notice in the Federal Register upon the establishment and/or modification of a Privacy Act system of records
Incorporates system of records notice elements of withdrawn App J controls IP-2 and TR-2

new_rev5_only.title: System of Records Notice | Routine Uses
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: The Privacy Act requires agencies to review all routine uses published in the system of records notice to ensure continued accuracy, and to ensure that routine uses continue to be compatible with the purpose for which the information was collected

new_rev5_only.title: System of Records Notice | Exemption Rules
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: At a minimum, organizations’ Privacy Act exemption regulations include the specific name(s) of any system(s) of records that will be exempt, the specific provisions from which the system(s) of records is to be exempted, the reasons for the exemption, and an explanation for why the exemption is both necessary and appropriate

new_rev5_only.title: Specific Categories of Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Organizations apply any conditions or protections that may be necessary for specific categories of personally identifiable information; these conditions may be required by laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, or guidelines

new_rev5_only.title: Specific Categories of Personally Identifiable Information | Social Security Numbers
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Federal law and policy establish specific requirements for organizations’ processing of Social Security numbers; organizations take steps to eliminate unnecessary uses of Social Security numbers and other sensitive information, and observe any particular requirements that apply

new_rev5_only.title: Specific Categories of Personally Identifiable Information | First Amendment Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: The Privacy Act limits agencies’ ability to process information that describes how individuals exercise rights guaranteed by the First Amendment

new_rev5_only.title: Computer Matching Requirements
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: The Privacy Act establishes requirements for federal and non-federal agencies if they engage in a matching program; a matching program involves not just the matching activity itself, but also the investigative follow-up and ultimate action, if any

new_rev5_only.title: Impact-Level Prioritization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Conduct an impact-level prioritization of organizational systems to obtain additional granularity on system impact levels

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Assessment | Supply Chain Risk Assessment
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Assess supply chain risks associated with specified systems, system components, and system services and update the supply chain risk assessment at a specified frequency when there are significant changes to the relevant supply chain, or when changes to the system, environments of operation, or other conditions necessitate a change in the supply chain

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Assessment | Use of All-Source Intelligence
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Use all-source intelligence to assist in the analysis of risk
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(8)

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Assessment | Dynamic Threat Awareness
new_rev5_only.change_details: Determine the current cyber threat environment on an ongoing basis

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Assessment | Predictive Cyber Analytics
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ advanced automation and analytics capabilities to predict and identify risks

new_rev5_only.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning | Public Disclosure Program
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Establish public reporting channel for receiving reports of vulnerabilities in organizational systems and system components

new_rev5_only.title: Risk Response
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Respond to findings from security and privacy assessments, monitoring, and audits in accordance with organizational risk tolerance; determine an appropriate response to risk before generating a plan of action and milestones entry

new_rev5_only.title: Privacy Impact Assessments
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Conduct privacy impact assessments for systems, programs, or other activities before developing or procuring information technology that will process PII or before initiating a new collection of PII
Incorporates privacy impact assessment elements of withdrawn App J control AR-2

new_rev5_only.title: Criticality Analysis
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to M and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Identify critical system components and functions by performing a criticality analysis for specified systems, system components, or system services at specified decision points in the system development life cycle
Incorporates withdrawn controls SA-12(13) and SA-14

new_rev5_only.title: Threat Hunting
new_rev5_only.change_details: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability

new_rev5_only.title: System Development Life Cycle | Manage Preproduction Environment
new_rev5_only.change_details: Protect system preproduction environments commensurate with risk throughout the system development life cycle for the system, system component, or system service

new_rev5_only.title: System Development Life Cycle | Use of Live or Operational Data
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Use of live or operational data in preproduction environments
Includes withdrawn control SA-15(9)

new_rev5_only.title: System Development Life Cycle | Technology Refresh
new_rev5_only.change_details: Plan for and implement a technology refresh schedule for the system throughout the system development life cycle

new_rev5_only.title: Acquisition Process | System of Records
new_rev5_only.change_details: Include Privacy Act requirements in the acquisition contract for operation of a System of Records

new_rev5_only.title: Acquisition Process | Data Ownership
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Include  data ownership requirements in the acquisition contract and 
require removal the data from contractor systems within specified timeframe

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Clear Abstractions
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement clear abstractions:  a system has simple, well-defined interfaces and functions that provide a consistent and intuitive view of the data and how it is managed

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Least Common Mechanism
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement least common mechanism:  the amount of mechanism common to more than one user and depended on by all users is minimized

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Modularity and Layering
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement  modularity and layering:  derived from functional decomposition, modularity and layering are effective in managing system complexity by making it possible to comprehend the structure of the system

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Partially Ordered Dependencies
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement partially ordered dependencies:  the synchronization, calling, and other dependencies in the system are partially ordered

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Efficiently Mediated Access
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement efficiently mediated access:  policy enforcement mechanisms utilize the least common mechanism available while satisfying stakeholder requirements within expressed constraints

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Minimized Sharing
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement minimized sharing:  no computer resource is shared between system components (e.g., subjects, processes, functions) unless it is absolutely necessary to do so

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Reduced Complexity
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement reduced complexity:  the system design is as simple and small as possible, making it more understandable, more analyzable, and less prone to error

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure Evolvability
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure evolvability:  a system is developed to facilitate the maintenance of its security properties when there are changes to the system’s structure, interfaces, interconnections (i.e., system architecture), functionality, or configuration (i.e., security policy enforcement)

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Trusted Components
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement  trusted components:  a component is trustworthy to at least a level commensurate with the security dependencies it supports (i.e., how much it is trusted to perform its security functions by other components)

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Hierarchical Trust
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement hierarchical trust:  builds on the principle of trusted components and states that the security dependencies in a system will form a partial ordering if they preserve the principle of trusted components

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Inverse Modification Threshold
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement inverse modification threshold:  builds on the principle of trusted components and the principle of hierarchical trust and states that the degree of protection provided to a component is commensurate with its trustworthiness

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Hierarchical Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement hierarchical protection:  a component need not be protected from more trustworthy components

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Minimized Security Elements
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement minimized security elements:  the system does not have extraneous trusted components

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Least Privilege
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement least privilege:  each system component is allocated sufficient privileges to accomplish its specified functions but no more

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Predicate Permission
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement predicate permission:  system designers consider requiring multiple authorized entities to provide consent before a highly critical operation or access to highly sensitive data, information, or resources is allowed to proceed

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Self-Reliant Trustworthiness
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement self-reliant trustworthiness:  systems minimize their reliance on other systems for their own trustworthiness

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure Distributed Composition
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure distributed composition:  the composition of distributed components that enforce the same system security policy result in a system that enforces that policy at least as well as the individual components do

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Trusted Communications Channels
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement trusted communications channels:  when composing a system where there is a potential threat to communications between components (i.e., the interconnections between components), each communication channel is trustworthy to a level commensurate with the security dependencies it supports (i.e., how much it is trusted by other components to perform its security functions)

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Continuous Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement continuous protection:  components and data used to enforce the security policy have uninterrupted protection that is consistent with the security policy and the security architecture assumptions

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure Metadata Management
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure metadata management:  metadata are “first class” objects with respect to security policy when the policy requires either complete protection of information or that the security subsystem be self-protecting

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Self-Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement self-analysis:  a system component is able to assess its internal state and functionality to a limited extent at various stages of execution, and that this self-analysis capability is commensurate with the level of trustworthiness invested in the system

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Accountability and Traceability
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement accountability and traceability:  it is possible to trace security-relevant actions (i.e., subject-object interactions) to the entity on whose behalf the action is being taken

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure Defaults
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure defaults:  the default configuration of a system (including its constituent subsystems, components, and mechanisms) reflects a restrictive and conservative enforcement of security policy

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure Failure and Recovery
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure failure and recovery:  neither a failure in a system function or mechanism nor any recovery action in response to failure leads to a violation of security policy

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Economic Security
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement economic security:  security mechanisms are not costlier than the potential damage that could occur from a security breach

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Performance Security
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement performance security:  security mechanisms are constructed so that they do not degrade system performance unnecessarily

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Human Factored Security
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement human factored security:  the user interface for security functions and supporting services is intuitive, user-friendly, and provides feedback for user actions that affect such policy and its enforcement

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Acceptable Security
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement acceptable security:  the level of privacy and performance that the system provides is consistent with the users’ expectations

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Repeatable and Documented Procedures
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement repeatable and documented procedures:  the techniques and methods employed to construct a system component permit the same component to be completely and correctly reconstructed at a later time

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Procedural Rigor
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement procedural rigor:  the rigor of a system life cycle process is commensurate with its intended trustworthiness

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Secure System Modification
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement secure system modification:  system modification maintains system security with respect to the security requirements and risk tolerance of stakeholders

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Sufficient Documentation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement sufficient documentation:  organizational personnel with responsibilities to interact with the system are provided with adequate documentation and other information such that the personnel contribute to rather than detract from system security

new_rev5_only.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles | Minimization
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Implement minimization:  organizations should only process personally identifiable information that is directly relevant and necessary to accomplish an authorized purpose, and should only maintain personally identifiable information for as long as is necessary to accomplish the purpose
Incorporates data minimization principle of withdrawn App J control DM-1

new_rev5_only.title: External System Services | Organization-Controlled Cryptographic Keys
new_rev5_only.change_details: Maintain exclusive control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system, preventing decryption of organizational data by external system staff

new_rev5_only.title: External System Services | Organization-Controlled Integrity Checking
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide the capability to check the integrity of information while it resides in the external system without transferring it out of the external system

new_rev5_only.title: External System Services | Processing and Storage Location - U.S. Jurisdiction
new_rev5_only.change_details: Restrict the geographic location of information processing and data storage to facilities located within in the legal jurisdictional boundary of the United States as the location can have a direct impact on the ability of organizations to successfully execute their core missions and business functions

new_rev5_only.title: Developer Configuration Management | Security and Privacy Representatives
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires designated security and privacy representatives to be included in the specified configuration change management and control process

new_rev5_only.title: Developer Testing and Evaluation | Interactive Application Security Testing
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ interactive application security testing tools to identify flaws and document the results, confirming control effectiveness

new_rev5_only.title: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Minimize Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.change_details: Require the developer of a system to minimize personally identifiable information

new_rev5_only.title: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Orchestration
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires the designing of critical systems or system components using coordinated behavior to implement capabilities, by system or component, to avert negative interactions

new_rev5_only.title: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Design Diversity
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires the use of different designs for critical systems or system components to satisfy a common set of requirements or to provide equivalent functionality

new_rev5_only.title: Specialization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires employing the selection of (one or more): design modification, augmentation, reconfiguration on specified systems or system components supporting mission essential services or functions to increase the trustworthiness in those systems or components

new_rev5_only.title: Separation of System and User Functionality | Disassociability
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires storing state information from applications and software separately to better protect individuals’ privacy

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Personally Identifiable Information
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Addresses boundary protection needs for systems that process, store, or transmit personally identifiable information

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Unclassified National Security System Connections
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Prohibit the direct connection of specified systems to an external network without the use of a specified boundary protection device
Incorporates withdrawn control CA-3(1)

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Classified National Security System Connections
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Prohibit the direct connection of a classified, national security system to an external network without the use of a specified boundary protection device
Incorporates withdrawn control CA-3(2)

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Unclassified Non-National Security System Connections
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Addresses the need for boundary protection devices to mediate communications and information flows between unclassified non-national security systems and external networks
Incorporates withdrawn control CA-3(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Connections to Public Networks
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Prohibits the direct connection of specified systems to a public network
Incorporates withdrawn control CA-3(4)

new_rev5_only.title: Boundary Protection | Separate Subnets to Isolate Functions
new_rev5_only.change_details: Addresses the need to separate critical system components and functions from noncritical system components and functions to reduce susceptibility to breach or compromise

new_rev5_only.title: Protected Distribution System
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement specific protected distribution system to (one or more) prevent unauthorized disclosure of information, detect changes to information during transmission

new_rev5_only.title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Physical Control of Keys
new_rev5_only.change_details: Maintaining physical control of cryptographic keys provides additional assurance that information stored by external providers is not subject to unauthorized disclosure or modification

new_rev5_only.title: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes | Anti-Spoofing Mechanisms
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement anti-spoofing mechanisms to prevent adversaries from falsifying the security attributes

new_rev5_only.title: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes | Cryptographic Binding
new_rev5_only.change_details: Cryptographic mechanisms and techniques can provide strong security and privacy attribute binding to transmitted information.

new_rev5_only.title: Protection of Information At Rest | Cryptographic Keys
new_rev5_only.change_details: Provide protected storage for cryptographic keys

new_rev5_only.title: System Partitioning | Separate Physical Domains for Privileged Functions
new_rev5_only.change_details: Partition privileged functions into separate physical domains

new_rev5_only.title: Distributed Processing and Storage | Synchronization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Synchronize specified duplicate systems or system components to ensure that information contained in distributed locations can be used in the mission or business functions of organizations

new_rev5_only.title: Sensor Capability and Data | Notice of Collection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Promotes an individual’s awareness that personally identifiable information is being collected by organization-defined sensors using organization-defined measures

new_rev5_only.title: Sensor Capability and Data | Collection Minimization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Emphasizes that organization-defined sensors be configured to minimize the collection of information about individuals that is not needed

new_rev5_only.title: System Time Synchronization
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires the synchronizing of system clocks within and between systems and system components

new_rev5_only.title: System Time Synchronization | Synchronization with Authoritative Time Source
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Synchronization of internal system clocks with an authoritative source provides uniformity of time stamps
Incorporates withdrawn control AU-8(1)

new_rev5_only.title: System Time Synchronization | Secondary Authoritative Time Source
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ geolocation information to determine if the secondary authoritative time source is in a different geographic region
Incorporates withdrawn control AU-8(2)

new_rev5_only.title: Cross Domain Policy Enforcement
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires implementing a physical and/or logical policy enforcement mechanism between the physical and/or network interfaces for the connecting security domains

new_rev5_only.title: Alternate Communications Paths
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires establishing organization-defined alternate communications paths for system operations organizational command and control

new_rev5_only.title: Sensor Relocation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires relocating organization-defined sensors and monitoring capabilities to organization-defined locations under organization-defined conditions or circumstances

new_rev5_only.title: Sensor Relocation | Dynamic Relocation of Sensors or Monitoring Capabilities
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires dynamically relocating organization-defined sensors and monitoring capabilities to organization-defined locations under specified  conditions or circumstances

new_rev5_only.title: Hardware-Enforced Separation and Policy Enforcement
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires implementing hardware-enforced separation and policy enforcement mechanisms between organization-defined security domains

new_rev5_only.title: Software-Enforced Separation and Policy Enforcement
new_rev5_only.change_details: Requires implementing software-enforced separation and policy enforcement mechanisms between organization-defined security domains

new_rev5_only.title: Hardware-Based Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Requires identification of firmware components for which manually disabling hardware write-protection and re-enabling after modification is needed  prior to returning to operational mode
Incorporates withdrawn control SC-34(3)

new_rev5_only.title: Flaw Remediation | Automated Patch Management Tools
new_rev5_only.change_details:
This enhancement was withdrawn in Rev4, but restored in Rev5
Requires automated patch management tools for specified system components

new_rev5_only.title: Optimize Network Traffic Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details: Optimize the effectiveness of monitoring devices

new_rev5_only.title: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity | Runtime Application Self-Protection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Implement controls for application self-protection at runtime

new_rev5_only.title: Information Input Validation | Injection Prevention
new_rev5_only.change_details: Prevent untrusted data injections

new_rev5_only.title: Information Management and Retention | Limit Personally Identifiable Information Elements
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Limit personally identifiable information being processed in the information life cycle to specified elements

new_rev5_only.title: Information Management and Retention | Minimize Personally Identifiable Information In Testing, Training, and Research
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Use specified techniques to minimize the use of personally identifiable information for research, testing, or training
Incorporates limitation of PII processing elements of withdrawn App J control DM-1, and techniques for minimization elements of withdrawn App J control DM-3

new_rev5_only.title: Information Management and Retention | Information Disposal
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Use specified techniques to dispose of, destroy, or erase information when it is no longer needed
Incorporates information disposal elements of withdrawn App J control DM-2

new_rev5_only.title: Non-Persistence | Non-Persistent Information
new_rev5_only.change_details: Control is about refreshing or generating information and deleting information when no longer needed

new_rev5_only.title: Non-Persistence | Non-Persistent Connectivity
new_rev5_only.change_details: Control is about reducing vulnerabilities through not maintaining persistent connections longer than needed

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Focus is on maintaining the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, and completeness PII across the information life cycle
Incorporates withdrawn App J control DI-1, and correction and deletion elements of withdrawn App J control IP-3

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations | Automation Support
new_rev5_only.change_details: Use automated mechanisms to correct or delete PII that is inaccurate or outdated, incorrectly determined regarding impact, or incorrectly de-identified

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations | Data Tags
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ data tags to automate the correction or deletion of PII across the information life cycle

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations | Collection
new_rev5_only.change_details: Collect personally identifiable information directly from the individual

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations | Individual Requests
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Correct or delete PII upon request by individuals or their designated representatives
Incorporates individual request elements of withdrawn App J control IP-3

new_rev5_only.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations | Notice of Correction or Deletion
new_rev5_only.change_details: Notify specified recipients of PII and individuals that the personally identifiable information has been corrected or deleted

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to Privacy Control Baseline (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Notify specified recipients of PII and individuals that the personally identifiable information has been corrected or deleted
Incorporates individual notification elements of withdrawn App J control IP-3

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Collection
new_rev5_only.change_details: De-identify the dataset upon collection by not collecting PII

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Archiving
new_rev5_only.change_details: Prohibit archiving of PII elements if those elements in a dataset will not be needed after the dataset is archived

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Release
new_rev5_only.change_details: Remove PII elements from a dataset prior to its release if those elements in the dataset do not need to be part of the data release

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing, or Replacement of Direct Identifiers
new_rev5_only.change_details: Remove, mask, encrypt, hash, or replace direct identifiers in a dataset

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Statistical Disclosure Control
new_rev5_only.change_details: Manipulate numerical data, contingency tables, and statistical findings so that no individual or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Differential Privacy
new_rev5_only.change_details: Prevent disclosure of PII by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification |Validated Algorithms and Software
new_rev5_only.change_details: Perform de-identification using validated algorithms and software that is validated to implement the algorithms

new_rev5_only.title: De-Identification | Motivated Intruder
new_rev5_only.change_details: Perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified

new_rev5_only.title: Tainting
new_rev5_only.change_details: Embed data or capabilities in specified systems or system components to determine if organizational data has been exfiltrated or improperly removed from the organization

new_rev5_only.title: Information Refresh
new_rev5_only.change_details: Refresh specified information at specified frequencies or generate the information on demand and delete the information when no longer needed

new_rev5_only.title: Information Diversity
new_rev5_only.change_details: Identify alternative sources of information for essential functions and services and use an alternative information source for the execution of essential functions or services when the primary source of information is corrupted or unavailable

new_rev5_only.title: Information Fragmentation
new_rev5_only.change_details: Based on circumstances, fragment specified information and distribute the fragmented information across specified systems or system components

new_rev5_only.title: (Supply Chain Risk Management) Policy and Procedures
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Addresses policy and procedures for controls in the SR family

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Addresses developing, implementing, periodically reviewing, and protecting the supply chain risk management plan

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan | Establish SCRM Team
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New control enhancement
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details: Addresses establishment of an SCRM  team to lead and support SCRM activities

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Addresses need to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes, employ controls to protect against supply chain risks, and document the selected and implemented supply chain processes and controls
Incorporates withdrawn controls SA-12(3) and SA-12(15)

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Diverse Supply Base
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ a diverse set of sources for specified system components and services
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(4)

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Limitation of Harm
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ specified supply chain controls to limit harm from potential adversaries identifying and targeting the organizational supply chain
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(5)

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Sub-tier Flow Down
new_rev5_only.change_details: Ensure controls included in the contracts of prime contractors are also included in the contracts of subcontractors

new_rev5_only.title: Provenance
new_rev5_only.change_details: Document, monitor, and maintain valid provenance of specified systems, system components, and associated data component and associated data

new_rev5_only.title: Provenance | Identity
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Establish and maintain unique identification of specified supply chain elements, processes, and personnel associated with the identified system and critical system components
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(14)

new_rev5_only.title: Provenance | Track and Trace
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Establish and maintain unique identification of specified systems and critical system components for tracking through the supply chain
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(14)

new_rev5_only.title: Provenance | Validate As Genuine and Not Altered
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ specified controls to validate that the system or system component received is genuine and has not been altered
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(10)

new_rev5_only.title: Provenance | Supply Chain Integrity — Pedigree
new_rev5_only.change_details: Employ specified controls and conduct specified analysis to ensure the integrity of the system and system components by validating the internal composition and provenance of critical or mission-essential technologies, products, and services

new_rev5_only.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:
New base control
Adds to L, M, and H Security Control Baselines (SP 800-53B)
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ specified acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods to protect against, identify, and mitigate supply chain risks
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(1)

new_rev5_only.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods | Adequate Supply
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ specified controls to ensure an adequate supply of critical system components
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(6)

new_rev5_only.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods | Assessments Prior to Selection, Acceptance, Modification, or Update
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Perform assessments of  systems, system components, or system services prior to selection, acceptance, modification, or update. 
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(7)

new_rev5_only.title: Supplier Assessments and Reviews

New base control

new_rev5_only.change_details:
Assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors and the system, system component, or system service they provide  
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(2)

new_rev5_only.title: Supplier Assessments and Reviews |  Testing and Analysis
new_rev5_only.change_details:
Employ specified analysis or testing of specified supply chain elements, processes, and actors associated with the system, system component, or system service
Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(11)

new_rev5_only.title: Supply Chain Operations Security

new_rev5_only.title: Notification Agreements

Incorporates withdrawn control SA-12(12)

new_rev5_only.title: Tamper Resistance and Detection

new_rev5_only.title: Tamper Resistance and Detection | Multiple Stages of System Development Life Cycle

new_rev5_only.change_details:

new_rev5_only.title: Inspection of Systems or Components

new_rev5_only.title: Component Authenticity

new_rev5_only.title: Component Authenticity | Anti-Counterfeit Training
new_rev5_only.changed_elements:

new_rev5_only.change_details:

new_rev5_only.title: Component Authenticity | Configuration Control for Component Service and Repair
